page.title: 07Staploe, Mormon Connection
page.content: A few barns, a pond and some uneven ground remain from Manor Farm, Honeydon, home of our only candidate for world celebrity. Mary Fielding, future wife of Hyrum, the brother of Joseph Smith founder and first President of the Mormon Church, lived there until 1834, with her Methodist family. Mary followed her brother and sister to Canada, where they all became Mormon converts. Her brother temporarily returnedand unsuccessfully tried to convert local Methodists. In America Mary met and married Hyrum, a widower with 5 children. While the new church was struggling for existence against savage attacks, she had 2 children. Then her husband and brother-in-law were imprisoned and killed by a mob in Carthage Gaol. With 7 children Mary trekked to Salt Lake. Her son became 6th President.
